title: Moral Money: 'I'm moving back to the UK and own a small flat in Australia – should I tell the taxman?'
text:
I have recently returned to the UK after a long spell out of the country living in Australia. I have just purchased a house for £350,000 and have now turned to fill in my stamp duty return.

The rules have changed a lot since I moved away and there is now a surcharge on the purchases of additional homes which, I understand, also applies to property owned overseas.

I own a small flat in Australia. I’ve not had it valued but I’d be surprised if it’s worth much more than £50,000. Declaring it would increase our tax bill from £7,500 to an eye-watering £18,000.

I’m tempted to say nothing but am worried I will feel guilty. What should I do?

Anon, York (via Australia)

You find yourselves caught out...
description: I have recently returned to the UK after a long spell out of the country living in Australia.
